titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Doris Bry Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 05:12

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, publication material, art work, printed material, photographs, and other papers relating to Doris Bry's editorial projects and professional association with Georgia O'Keeffe.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
The collection is comprised of material formerly classed as: Uncat MSS 433, Uncat MSS 635, Uncat MSS 1027.

The collection received preliminary processing at the time of acquisition. Further rehousing, and description were carried out in 2014. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with and/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section. Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Doris Bry
bioghist.p: Doris Bry is a scholar of Alfred Stieglitz, and was Georgia O'Keeffe's business agent and confidant. She is the author of Alfred Stieglietz: Photographer (1965), and editor or co-editor of Some Memories of Drawings (by Georgia O'Keeffe, 1974) , Georgia O'Keeffe, in the West (1989), and Georgia O'Keeffe: The New York Years (1991).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, publication material, art work, printed material, photographs, and other papers relating to Doris Bry's various editorial projects and professional association with Georgia O'Keeffe.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three groupings: November 2002 Acquisition; February 2004 Acquisition; and June 2008 Acquisition.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
13 (Art)-14 (Art), Boxes 15 (Oversize)-17 (Oversize), 18 (Art)-20 (Art) and 21 (Roll): Restricted material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of publication materials, some related to Georgia O'Keeffe. Includes works by Richard Benson and others, magazines, sample book covers, Artforum magazine, mechanicals for Some Memories of Drawings , Irving Penn proofs of Mud Glove , and other related papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 13 (Art)-14 (Art), Boxes 15 (Oversize)-17 (Oversize), 18 (Art)-20 (Art) and 21 (Roll): Restricted material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into four groupings: Correspondence, Gifts by Artists, Printed Material, and Georgia O'Keeffe Prints (Framed)

did.unittitle: Doris Bry and Barbara Lynes correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a photogravure proof by Richard Benson for Eakins Press, from the Beinecke Library's Carl Van Vechten negative.

did.unittitle: Binder used by Alfred Stieglitz for "Camera Work"
Clarke, Bert - layout and design of tray cases for "Camera Work"
Evans, Frederich H. - "Turn-Elliptic Pendulum Cruves" (gift of Sam Wagstaff)

"Honk if you Love Stieglitz," auto sticker

KQED * 9, Georgia O'Keeffe, photographs by Jim Farber, San Francisco
Meriden Gravure Co. proof - "Walker Evans: Forty Years"
Scheinbaum & Russek Ltd. - three Christmas cards and photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes invitations for O'Keeffe retrospective exhibitions, 1946 and 1970/1971, and an Alfred Stieglitz exhibtion at the Museum of Modern Art, 1947.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes pamphlets, programs, gallery guides, catalogues, and newspapers about artists and photographers.
